programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Use shapes in new ways. Modern Quilt Guild marketing director Heather Grant discusses the modern quilt aesthetic and modern quilt designs. Blogger Rossie Hutchinson joins quilter Elizabeth Dackson to talk about improv quilt events. Instructor Rebecca Kemp Brent uses the latest cutting and quilting technology to create a confetti star quilt design.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela's reminded of her age as she relies on her kids to keep up with the digital world. Watch as she uses two basic shapes to create a mod half-square triangle quilt that's easier to make than it looks.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Wish you could make your quilting mistakes disappear? Angela is here to show you how. Well, at least how to hide them by using a matching thread color, echoing and repeating a mistake to make it look intentional.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela's been challenged by The Crafty Gemini to make a stash-busting tote bag. So she's stepping outside her comfort zone and up to the #MidnightStashChallenge!

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Vintage styles continue to cycle thru our wardrobes with subtle updates. Gretchen Hirsch epitomizes that vintage style with a lace bolero. Then, it's Kim Montagnese. Watch as she recycles a jacket with vintage details and demonstrates techniques for adding trims, lace and more. The show closes with Joanne Banko sharing tips for cutting and sewing silky fabrics.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Show off your style, when you create table top glamour. Your table is the star with this table setting from Rebecca Kemp Brent. Create beautiful accents and all over patterns using a frame. Then meet Joanne Hillestad and a beautiful table runner. This quick project personalizes your décor by season or color. Finally Angela is back with another tank variation; this time it's a lace insert.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: With a few supplies and cold connection techniques, designer Abbi Berta quickly creates mixed media earrings. She also makes a textured cuff with a torch-fired patina to introduce metalwork. Viewer Leslie Rocha tells how her first jewelry class and love of music blossomed into a passion for making jewelry from guitar wire and picks.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Express your style in metalwork and with lettering, too. Mary Hettmansperger adds a window in metal work to make a versatile bezel. She adds style by layering metals and putting a variety of motifs behind the window. Creative collaborator Brenda Schweder shares her favorite tips on soldering metalwork. Katie Hacker puts her style into words with lettering in Katie's Beading Lesson.

programme.title: Scrapbook Soup
programme.desc: Soup would be pretty boring if it was just broth. Scrapbook pages might also suffer the same fate without some interesting add-ons to rev them up. Explore beyond the norm with media mixage with Stacey Caron, add bezels, ribbon and buttons to create texture and dimension. Make a die cut frame with Jenny Barnett Rohrs and use up scraps of patterned paper in a grid design with Ronda Palazzari. Today's Scrapbook Soup is stocked with new ingredients.

programme.title: Chemo Caps
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Knitting
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: All quilters can get stuck in a creative rut, even Angela. This week, she turns to strip piecing and her fun, easy-to-piece chevron pattern to get her quilting mojo back. Plus, she'll show you how to use negative space to bring your quilt to life.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This is not a drill! Angela has heard your requests loud and clear, and she's finally making the Bargello quilt that everyone's been asking for! So break out the layer cakes and prepare to get crazy with precuts.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela's back and bursting with love. In this season premiere, she uses half-square triangles to make a modern bursting star quilt while sharing her tips on how to keep a lasting relationship with a quilter.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This week Angela is preparing to host a dinner for quilters, so of course, she has to quilt up a few placemats!

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Sewing experts offer easy ways to create neat sewing projects right at home. Viewers of all skill levels learn tips and techniques for creating professional-looking garments, personalized apparel and home accents. Weekly episodes feature various themes, and feature two main projects and one shorter technique segment. Some projects include monogramming napkins and towels; baby poncho, hooded towel and baby-friendly diapers; embellishing yoga pants with a clothing tattoo; and sewing on knits.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: An all-white cake doesn't have to be plain. JJR is back and bolder than ever with this four-tier white monochrome wedding cake.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Joshua John Russell creates modern, edible masterpieces with cake, fondant and buttercream.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: These monsters just dropped in to say HAPPY BIRTHDAY!

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Watch JJR make ombré fondant ruffles and stud this cake with incredible custom "gems."

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Whether indoors or out, games are fun! Bowl at home with family and friends with a colorful bowling set Katie makes from recycled water bottles. Franz shows how to create your own game board using a variety of art mediums. Jenny and Katie make an indoor hopscotch court that rolls-up, for easy storage. Braid a ring toss toy then use the Family Craft box to make a treasure hunt jar for quiet fun.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Let's get creative with inspiration from the forest, sea and sky. Jenny Barnett-Rohrs and Katie Hacker make a friendly hedgehog then Katie creates a wiggly fish. Franz Spohn scratches off paint to make colorful animal images and Jenny makes a gelatin print Valentine's Day card.

programme.title: Drawing & Painting
programme.desc: Learn to draw and paint with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Perfect Pizza at Home
programme.desc: Learn to cook with CraftsyTV

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Forget milk and cookies, in Angela's house, it's all about the wine and popcorn. Spend the night before Christmas piecing triangles and playing with negative space while you wait up for Santa with Angela.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela whips up a stash-busting table topper using the quilt-as-you-go method Gudrun Erla teaches in her online class "Fast & Furious: Quilt-As-You-Go With Pre-Cuts."

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: She's Baaaaaack! Been itchin' for wine + stitchin'? Angela's kicking off a brand new season with a rather "puzzling" episode.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: In the final episode of the Holiday Gift-Along, your last-minute gift quilter, Angela Walters, is making a beginner-friendly criss cross quilt. This gift-able quilt project is much easier than it looks, so you still have time to make it before the holidays!

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Stitch it up with three very different sewing styles on this episode. Frist, Emily Thompson makes a mesh bag perfect for the beach. Then, it's cosplay expert Cheryl Sleboda with a tip for adding enlarger panels to your cosplay outfits for a perfect fit. Last is a stitching technique for adding pockets to joggers with Angela Wolf.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Make travel fashions work for day and evening. Fabric artist Kim Montagnese upcycles vintage ties to create new fashions. Designer and sewing educator Louis Carney takes daywear into the evening with embroidered appliques for belts, shoes and purses. Angela Wolf shares a tip for serging on knits.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: Beat single sock syndrome with a little multitasking! The girls go over how to knit two socks at once so you'll never end up with solo socks again.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.sub-title: T-Shirt Finishing Tips: Hems, Necklines + Weaving in Ends
programme.desc: So you’ve finished knitting your Novel-T, now what? Tune in to see how to weave in the ends when working with cotton yarn. Hint: this method involves fabric glue.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Break the creative boundaries and travel to the outer limits. Blast off as Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes a bottle rocket. Katie Hacker tracks the journey on a decorated bulletin board. Franz Spohn makes portraits with candy beads and we'll make a sparkly Easter decoration from blogger Jen Goode.

programme.title: Drawing & Painting
programme.desc: Learn to draw and paint with CraftsyTV.

programme.desc: Know a groom or bride with a dark side? Tackle this dark wedding cake with a surprising flavor profile!

programme.desc: Joshua John Russell creates modern, edible masterpieces with cake, fondant and buttercream.

programme.desc: In this episode of Man About Cake, we learn that shiny is a color, and edible lace isn't as difficult as it looks.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: Whether it holds recipes, keepsakes, sewing tools, or anything else, this handmade box makes a perfect last minute gift for any occasion. George Vondriska shows you how to whip up your own handmade box in just a few simple steps.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: The simple wooden spatula is an essential cooking tool that adds a handmade touch to any kitchen. George Vondriska demonstrates how to make your own wooden spatula in a few easy steps. This easy project makes a great gift for any home chef.

programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Learn how to put things together with piecing techniques. Catherine Cureton shows how to strip piece to save time. She cuts and sews strips together, then sub cuts before assembling into blocks. Next, Laura Hartrich creates pieced modern letters, making a whole alphabet with just three blocks. The machine tip segment features Eliane Bergmann demonstrating walking foot curves.
